section.title: Recovering Vertica after Network Outage
section.para: If you have a network outage in your cloud environment, or if Vertica loses network connection for any other reason, the database will go into a failed state and will have to be manually restarted. You can do this with these steps:

listitem.para: Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Run the hlm-status playbook to confirm the status:
You may see an error that looks like this, which indicates that the Vertica service is in a down state on one of the nodes in this cloud environment:
listitem.screen:
PLAY [vertica Status] *********************************************************
TASK: [verticad | Check vertica service status] ******************************* ok: [helion-ceph-ccp-c1-m3-mgmt] failed: [helion-ceph-ccp-c1-m2-mgmt] => {"changed": false, "cmd": ["/etc/init.d/verticad", "status"], "delta": "0:00:01.062019", "end": "2016-09-13 16:14:53.762205", "rc": 1, "start": "2016-09-13 16:14:52.700186", "stdout_lines": ["Vertica: status not OK"], "warnings": []} stdout: Vertica: status not OK ...ignoring ok: [helion-ceph-ccp-c1-m1-mgmt]

listitem.para: You can run the monasca-start playbook, which should restart it. You can specify a specific target node with the --limit switch if desired:
